2D visualization¶

Draw simulation results¶

cpm_tools.visualization_2d.draw_cpm_grid(sigma, tau, colormap, fn, scale=1, border_color=None, draw_border=True)[source]¶

Draw cpm grid

Draw cpm grid with any level of magnification and cell borders.

Parameters:
  • sigma – array with cell ids
  • tau – array with cell types
  • colormap – dictionary with tau as keys and colors (rgb tuples) as values
  • fn – filename used for saving
  • scale – image scaling
  • border_color – color of the cell borders
  • draw_border – draw cell borders
cpm_tools.visualization_2d_mpl.draw_cpm_grid_mpl(tau, colors, ax=None, fn=None, dpi=100, scale=1)[source]¶

Draw cpm grid using matplotlib.

Drawing the cpm grid using matplotlib is very fast, but does not support drawing cell borders.

Parameters:
  • tau – array with cell types
  • colors – list of matplotlib colornames, in the order of tau (see https://matplotlib.org/examples/color/named_colors.html)
  • ax – matplotlib ax to use
  • fn – filename used for saving
  • dpi – output image dpi
  • scale – scaling factor

Animate simulation results¶

cpm_tools.visualization_2d_mpl.animate_cpm_sim_mpl(tau_list, colors, fn=None, show=False, dpi=100, scale=1, fps=5)[source]¶

Animate cpm simulation using matplotlib

Parameters:
  • tau_list – list of grids with tau
  • colors – list of matplotlib colornames, in the order of tau (see https://matplotlib.org/examples/color/named_colors.html)
  • fn – filename used for saving the video
  • show – show animation
  • dpi – dpi
  • scale – scaling factor
  • fps – animation frame rate

Annotate images¶

cpm_tools.visualization_2d.add_color_bar(imname, colors, labels, w, h, fontcolor=(0, 0, 0), bgcolor=(255, 255, 255), fontpath='/usr/share/fonts/truetype/freefont/FreeSans.ttf', fontsize=24, outname=None, horizontal=False, title=None)[source]¶

Add colorbar to an image

Parameters:
  • imname – image filename
  • colors – list of colors
  • labels – list of labels
  • w – width of the colorbar
  • h – height of the colorbar
  • fontcolor – font color (r,g,b)
  • bgcolor – background color (r,g,b)
  • fontpath – path to font
  • fontsize – font size
  • outname – name of the new image
